sen.j: 宿院 良蔵（しゅくいん りょうぞう、文政4年（1821年）頃？ - 慶応4年1月6日 (旧暦)（1868年1月30日））は、壬生浪士組及び、新選組平隊士。
sen.e: Ryozo SHUKUIN (circa 1821 - January 30, 1868) was a common member of the Miburoshigumi (Mibu masterless warriors group, which was the forerunner of the Shinsengumi) and the Shinsengumi (literally, the newly selected corps, referring to a special police force for the Tokugawa regime).

sen.j: 出身は京都、もしくは丹波亀山藩。
sen.e: Ryozo was from Kyoto, or Kameyama Domain in Tanba Province.

sen.j: 死亡時の年齢は47・8歳だったというが真偽は不明。
sen.e: Ryozo is said to have died at the age of 47 or 48, which is, however, disputed.

sen.j: 一般的には池田屋事件に参戦した隊士として有名で、入隊時期に関しては、正確には不明なものの、文久3年（1863年9月30日）に起きた八月十八日の政変に参加している事から、それ以前、つまり、新選組の前身・壬生浪士組の頃からの隊士である。
sen.e: Generally, Ryozo has been famous for participating in the Ikedaya Incident, and although it is unclear when he joined the Shinsengumi, yet he participated in the Palace Coup of August 18 which occurred on September 30, 1863, thus making it possible to infer that he had been a member since the time of the Miburoshigumi which was the forerunner of the Shinsengumi.

sen.j: 元治元年6月5日（1864年7月8日）の池田屋事件では土方歳三隊に属し、屋外の守備を担当。
sen.e: In the Ikedaya Incident taking place in July 8, 1864, Ryozo was a troop of Toshizo HIJIKATA's unit, taking charge of defense outside of the Ikedaya.

sen.j: 同年9月(1864年10月）の葛山武八郎の切腹に際しては、谷三十郎と共に、頼越人となって光縁寺を訪れている。
sen.e: When Takehachiro KAZURAYAMA committed hara-kiri in October, 1864, Ryozo and Sanjuro TANI visited Koen-ji Temple as Tanomikoshibito (who were in charge of requesting burial of the deceased after hara-kiri and/or carrying the body of the deceased after hara-kiri) for Takehachiro.
